titles.title: Providing for consideration of a motion to dispose of the Senate amendment to the bill (H.R. 1643) to authorize the extension of nondiscriminatory treatment (most-favored-nation treatment) to the products of Bulgaria.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 104-447, by Mr. Dreier.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 1643. Upon adoption of this resolution, it shall be in order to take the bill from the Speaker's table, with the Senate amendment thereto, and to consider in the House the motion printed in the report accompanying this resolution. The Senate amendment and the motion shall be considered as read. All points of order against the motion shall be waived. The motion shall debatable for one hour. The previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motion.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 175.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 228 - 187 (Roll No. 6).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 1/4/1996--Introduced. Sets forth the rule for the consideration of a motion to dispose of the Senate amendment to H.R. 1643 (extension of most-favored-nation treatment to Bulgaria).
